p: In the Morogoro district, the Mikese ward had the highest RVFV seroprevalence at 55.3% (21/38) followed by Magadu at 32% (33/103) and Mazimbu 4.4% (3/68). In the Kyela district, the RVFV seroprevalence was 35.7% (25/70), 40.5% 15/37) and 17.5% (7/40) in Bujonde, Kajujumele, and Katumba Songwe wards respectively ( Fig 1, Table 2). There were statistical significant differences in RVFV seroprevalence between the wards in Morogoro district ( p < 0.001) ( Table 2). However, this was not the case for wards in the Kyela district ( p = 0.06) ( Table 2).
